title: Requiring an associated type to equal another associated type in short form causes ICE

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

body:
``` rust
trait Trait {
    type A;
    type B;
}

fn foo<T: Trait<A = T::B>>() { }

fn main() { }
```

``` text
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
```
